Legal_Issue: Did the visa officer violate procedural fairness by rejecting Mr. Hoque's application without seeking clarification on the number of employees?
Evidence_Assessment: Mr. Hoque provided financial statements but no direct evidence of employee numbers
Decision_Outcome: Visa application rejected due to lack of documentary evidence
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to provide sufficient documentary evidence
Credibility_Factor: Not applicable; decision based on documentation, not credibility
Legal_Rule: Visa officers are not required to seek additional information if the applicant fails to provide sufficient documentary evidence
Grounds_for_Claim: Failure by visa officer to request clarification on employee count
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: No breach of procedural fairness found
Key_Evidence_Considered: Financial statements, lack of employee documentation
Legal_Framework: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Section 88(1)
Applicant_Challenge: Visa officer did not seek clarification before rejection
Defendant_Response: Rejection based on insufficient documentation as per regulations
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to meet business qualification requirements due to insufficient evidence
